column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////We settled on sharing the baked goat cheese
column4: elote style corn and chocolate cream pie. Every dish was delicious!! The smoked trout caesar was probably the best caesar salad I've ever had. It was light and lemon-y and refreshingly good. The roasted bone marrow here is actually better than Au Cheval's. Why
column5: you ask? It's served with a sweet onion jam which balances the heaviness of the marrow itself. A match made in heaven. The most surprising dish of the evening would have to be the chocolate cream pie though. It may not look like much but it's a party in your mouth. One of the best pies I've ever had
column6: hands down. Next time I'm in the city and Au Cheval has its usual 3+ hour wait
column7: I'm coming here with no looking back.
